events.name: Low-carbon transition and energy storage
events.wd_description: The literature on low-carbon transition emphasizes the importance of improved energy storage to support the increasing demand for renewable energy technologies. Batteries are becoming more efficient with new materials but present challenges related to resource accessibility and waste management.
events.description: The literature on low-carbon transition emphasizes the importance of improved energy storage to support the increasing demand for renewable energy technologies. Batteries are becoming more efficient with new materials but present challenges related to resource accessibility and waste management.

events.name: Improved energy storage
events.wd_description: Energy storage is crucial for the low-carbon transition, supporting technologies that use renewable energy sources.
events.description: Energy storage is crucial for the low-carbon transition, supporting technologies that use renewable energy sources.

events.name: Battery efficiency
events.wd_description: Batteries have been improving in efficiency with the introduction of new materials to increase energy density.
events.description: Batteries have been improving in efficiency with the introduction of new materials to increase energy density.

events.name: Resource accessibility
events.wd_description: The increased demand for metals and minerals highlights problems with resource accessibility.
events.description: The increased demand for metals and minerals highlights problems with resource accessibility.

events.name: Waste management
events.wd_description: Waste management becomes a significant issue as demand for battery materials increases.
events.description: Waste management becomes a significant issue as demand for battery materials increases.

events.name: Supply risk of critical raw materials
events.wd_label: Supply risk of critical raw materials
events.wd_description: The supply risk of critical raw materials like cobalt, aluminum, copper, and nickel remains stable, with cobalt having the highest supply risk due to geopolitical factors. The GeoPolEndpoint method highlights the economic damages associated with resource use.
events.description: The supply risk of critical raw materials like cobalt, aluminum, copper, and nickel remains stable, with cobalt having the highest supply risk due to geopolitical factors. The GeoPolEndpoint method highlights the economic damages associated with resource use.

events.name: Stable supply risk
events.wd_description: The supply risk of aluminum, cobalt, copper, and nickel is considered stable over the analyzed period.
events.description: The supply risk of aluminum, cobalt, copper, and nickel is considered stable over the analyzed period.

events.name: Highest supply risk
events.wd_description: Cobalt stands out with the highest supply risk, reflecting the geopolitical risks in its supply chain, primarily involving the Democratic Republic of Congo and China.
events.description: Cobalt stands out with the highest supply risk, reflecting the geopolitical risks in its supply chain, primarily involving the Democratic Republic of Congo and China.

events.name: Economic damages
events.wd_description: The transition to an endpoint level highlights the economic damages associated with cobalt use.
events.description: The transition to an endpoint level highlights the economic damages associated with cobalt use.

events.name: Comparison of abiotic depletion potential and supply risk
events.wd_label: Comparison of abiotic depletion potential and supply risk
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method highlights the supply constraints of cobalt and the increasing participation of China and Russia in the aluminum supply mix to the European Union. This method adds a layer of assessment by focusing on barriers to resource accessibility.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method highlights the supply constraints of cobalt and the increasing participation of China and Russia in the aluminum supply mix to the European Union. This method adds a layer of assessment by focusing on barriers to resource accessibility.

events.name: Abiotic depletion potential
events.wd_description: Cobalt and aluminum gain higher visibility in supply risk assessments using the GeoPolRisk method.
events.description: Cobalt and aluminum gain higher visibility in supply risk assessments using the GeoPolRisk method.

events.name: Supply risk
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method reflects supply constraints for cobalt and the increasing role of China and Russia in the aluminum supply mix.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method reflects supply constraints for cobalt and the increasing role of China and Russia in the aluminum supply mix.

events.name: GeoPolRisk method
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method highlights barriers to resource accessibility rather than overall geological availability.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method highlights barriers to resource accessibility rather than overall geological availability.

events.name: Data limitations and focus on mining stages
events.wd_label: Data limitations and focus on mining stages
events.wd_description: Most open data sources focus on mining and refining stages, with the GeoPolRisk method privileging mining information. Further stages of the supply chain present challenges in data tracking and supply risk assessment.
events.description: Most open data sources focus on mining and refining stages, with the GeoPolRisk method privileging mining information. Further stages of the supply chain present challenges in data tracking and supply risk assessment.

events.name: Data limitations
events.wd_description: Data tracking becomes more challenging as materials move through their life cycle, with most open data focusing on mining and refining stages.
events.description: Data tracking becomes more challenging as materials move through their life cycle, with most open data focusing on mining and refining stages.

events.name: Focus on mining stages
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method privileges the use of mining information due to data constraints.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method privileges the use of mining information due to data constraints.

events.name: Recycling considerations
events.wd_description: Recycling is considered a supply risk-mitigating factor but requires more work to identify impacts at further supply chain stages.
events.description: Recycling is considered a supply risk-mitigating factor but requires more work to identify impacts at further supply chain stages.

events.name: Limitations of the GeoPolRisk method
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method has limitations, particularly in analyzing coproducts and the supply risks of intermediary products. These limitations affect the overall assessment of supply chain risks.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method has limitations, particularly in analyzing coproducts and the supply risks of intermediary products. These limitations affect the overall assessment of supply chain risks.

events.name: Coproduct analysis
events.wd_description: The GeoPolRisk method analyzes resources mined together independently, which can limit the understanding of supply risks.
events.description: The GeoPolRisk method analyzes resources mined together independently, which can limit the understanding of supply risks.

events.name: Intermediary products
events.wd_description: The supply risks of intermediary products are not fully captured, representing a higher source of risk in the overall supply chain.
events.description: The supply risks of intermediary products are not fully captured, representing a higher source of risk in the overall supply chain.

events.name: Overall supply chain risks
events.wd_description: These limitations affect the overall assessment of supply chain risks using the GeoPolRisk method.
events.description: These limitations affect the overall assessment of supply chain risks using the GeoPolRisk method.
